description: Earliest sequence of 4 consecutive economical numbers.
links: J.-M. De Koninck and F. Luca, On strings of consecutive economical numbers of arbitrary length
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Economical Number
example: 179210312 = 2^3* 4733^2; 9 digits in 179219312, 7 digits in its prime factorization, 7 < 9, so that number is economical.
author: _Carlos Rivera_
